intro: Daviesia ruscifolia, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in dense clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Daviesia ruscifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
